channel.title: I'm switching to linux, some help please
channel.description: Ok, my old computer that was running on windows ME is a piece of crap right now so i am going to format it then install linux on it is this a good idea or not? also, how do i do it? i am downloading a version of linux now and im going to burn it in alchohal 120% to a CD then what do i do...

item.title: I'm switching to linux, some help please
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

Most of you are idiots.
F12 is to change boot device on Dell Laptops.
A lot of computers are set to boot from CD usually anyway, if not then just check out the BIOS and change the boot device priority to have CD at the top.

I recommend ubuntu personally - it’s an easy transition into the world of linux.

Read full topic
item.source: I'm switching to linux, some help please

item.title: I'm switching to linux, some help please
item.dc:creator: @Taylor Taylor
item.description:
@Taylor wrote:

[quote=“afi, post:2, topic:15057”]Press F12 and boot from CD and follow the on screen instructions.[/quote]some people have different bios

might have to change the first boot sector to “CDROM”

second one to “HARD DISK” or something

if you have a laptop of course do what afi said
